lines.content: [E]|false|Wayne attend CS2113 lecture /at Friday 17 Sep 2021 from 4-6pm

Duke is an application written in Java used for managing tasks, optimized for use via a Command Line Interface (CLI). It can be used to efficiently add, delete and search for relevant tasks, be it to-do tasks, deadlines or events.
There are three different type of tasks that can be added: Todo, Deadline and Event. Each type of task has a different format to follow.
For the first example, the following output will be shown:
```Now you have 1 tasks in the list```
Adds a deadline task with a due date.
For the first example, the following output will be shown:
```Now you have 1 tasks in the list```
Adds a event task with a due location/date.
For the first example, the following output will be shown:
```Now you have 1 tasks in the list```
Deletes a task based on its position on the list.
* ```delete 1``` deletes the first task in the list.
The user is also able to view all tasks in a list, as well as find specific task(s) based on keywords.
Shows a list of all available tasks.
An output of this format will be shown:
```Here are the tasks in your list:```
Finds task(s) with the matching keyword(s).
* ```find NUS``` finds tasks with 'NUS' in its description.
An output of this format will be shown:
```Here are the matching tasks in your list:```
Marks a task as done, based on its position in the list.
* ```done 1``` marks the first task in the list as done.
An output of this format will be shown:
```Nice! I've marked this task as done:```
The following output will be shown:
```Bye. Hope to see you again soon!```
* Duke keeps track of all your tasks in a reader-friendly format, even after you close the application.
* Parses the user input to find the appropriate Command to be executed.
* @param fullCommand The entire command that is inputted by the user.
* @throws NullPointerException if the description of the user input is not filled up.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index of the user input is greater than the size of TaskList.
* Loads and saves the taskList from/into a .txt file.
* @param filePath The file path (to a .txt file) from which taskList is loaded from or saved onto.
* @return (for load function) The saved TaskList from the .txt file in the path.
* @throws FileNotFoundException if the file path does not exist.

content += currentType + '|' + String.valueOf(currentTask.getIsDone()) + '|' + currentTask.getDescription() + "/at" + currentTask.getDueDate() + System.lineSeparator();

* In addition, the size of the TaskList, as well as specific Tasks, can be accessed.

* Command executed based off the user input.
